Class ChargedParticle

  • java.lang.Object
    • Particle
      • ChargedParticle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable

    public class ChargedParticle
extends Particle
    A Class to represent a massive, electrically charged particle
    Version:
    1.5
    Author:
    Ian Bailey, Jake Murkin

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChargedParticle

        public ChargedParticle()
        The Default Constructor. Sets everything to zero.

      • ChargedParticle

        public ChargedParticle(double mIn,
                       double qIn)
        Constructor with two inputs - the charge and mass of the particle. Set everything else to zero.
        Parameters:
        mIn - the mass
        qIn - the charge

      • ChargedParticle

        public ChargedParticle(double mIn,
                       double qIn,
                       PhysicsVector positionIn,
                       PhysicsVector velocityIn)
        Constructor that sets mass, charge, position and velocity
        Parameters:
        mIn - mass of the particle
        qIn - charge of the particle
        positionIn - initial position of particle
        velocityIn - initial velocity of particle

        public void rk4(double deltaTime,
                java.util.ArrayList<GeneralEMField> fields,

        Update the position and velocity of the particle using the runge-kutta 4 method
        Parameters:
        fields - The fields in the simulation
        time - the time
        deltaTime - The change in time

      • rk2

        public void rk2(double deltaTime,
                java.util.ArrayList<GeneralEMField> fields,
                double time)
        Update the position and velocity of the particle using the runge-kutta 2 method
        Parameters:
        fields - The fields in the simulation
        time - the time
        deltaTime - The change in time

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Create a string containing the mass, charge, position, velocity, and acceleration of the particle. This method is called automatically by System.out.println(someparticle)
        Overrides:
        toString in class Particle
        Returns:
        string with the format " mass "+mass+" charge "+charge+" Position: "+position+" Velocity: "+velocity+" Acceleration: "+acceleration
